result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas H. Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.**NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
----------------------

No violent contact with the victim. No alcohol. No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
----------------------

Complete intervention program at Silver Linings
----------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations. 
----------------------
Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent. Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

timeConds.notes:
The Defendant is to serve thirty (30) days in the Walworth County Jail with Work Release privileges to commence on or before November 25, 2022 @ 8:00 a.m. NOTE: The Defendant shall report to jail on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Failure to comply will result in revocation of work release privileges for a period of five (5) days unless reinstated by the Court. 
----------------------
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas H. Lopez in court. Right to attorney options form given; referred to State Public Defenders Office. Does not qualify for SPD. MFAC granted. $200 per month, first payment July 1st. Defendant moves to modify bond, states he sent in letter requesting no contact to be lifted, State did not get letter. Motion denied. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Starts counseling tomorrow. Signed up for assessment. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Court informs parties how to lift the no contact.
Notice of Arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

*AMENDED 8-4-2022: NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH V.E.E. "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 

Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH V.E.E. OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
